summary: This document is an email chain from August 16, 2019, detailing new procedures implemented by a new Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding inmate placement on suicide watch and psychological observation. It emphasizes the Warden's desire for direct notification and decision-making authority, and was sent shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Implementation of New Inmate Watch Procedures
events.description: A new Warden at MCC New York addresses staff and institutes strict new protocols requiring his direct, immediate notification for any inmate placed on or removed from suicide watch or psychological observation, and his personal approval for the use of inmate companions.
personsInvolved: Psy.D., Ph.D. Forensic Psychologist LCDR United States Public Health Service

keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, a new Warden at MCC New York implemented highly centralized procedures for inmate suicide and psychological watch.
The Warden demanded to be called directly, at any time of day, whenever an inmate was placed on or taken off suicide watch or psychological observation.
The Warden reserved sole decision-making authority for approving the use of inmate companions (as opposed to staff) to watch at-risk inmates.

This procedural change occurred just days before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the same facility on August 10, 2019 (note: the document date is August 16, 2019, which is after Epstein's death; this may indicate post-incident procedural review or the date is an error in the context).
